lines.content: * The Duke program implements a task manager that keep tracks
* of various tasks based on input given by user
* Main method to start off the entire program
* - Display a welcome message to user & read and act upon input given by user
* Constantly read and decipher user's input till an exit command is received from the user
// Constantly loop till exit command is received
// Save to file should there be updates to the task list
* This command allows adding of various types of tasks to the task manager.
// Literal command given by user, these represent the 4 different type of tasks available in the program.
Messages.DIVIDER_UNDERSCORE_EXTENDED + " Adds a task to the task list.\n"
+ " We currently provide support for 4 different type of task, namely:\n"
+ " 2) Deadline             : Task with a date which represent a deadline.\n"
+ " 3) Event                : Event with a date which represent the start date of the event.\n"
+ " 4) Fixed duration task  : Task that require a fixed amount of time to complete.\n\n"
+ " We currently support the following datetime for deadline / event:\n"
// - The remaining input given by the user after specifying the type of task
// Whether to display the results to the user
// --> This is as adding of tasks on startup (from saved filed) should not show result to the user
// - If the task is marked as done
* @param command The remaining input given by the user after specifying the type of task
* @param isSilent Whether to display the results to the user
* @param isDone If the task is to be marked as done
* @param command The remaining input given by the user after specifying the type of task
public AddCommand(boolean isSilent, TaskType type, boolean isDone, String command) {
assert type != null : "AddCommand constructor cannot have null TaskType!";
* From a given string, determine the type of task it represents

* This command allows the ease of duplicating task in the task manager
Messages.DIVIDER_UNDERSCORE_EXTENDED + " Clone an existing task in the task list.\n"
+ " The index specified should correspond to the index in the normal listing of tasks.\n"
+ " Type 'list' to view the normal listing of tasks.\n\n"
// - Index of task to be cloned
* @param index Index of the current task (in the task list) to be cloned
* @return Whether the command made any changes to the task list
* A Command class representing the command given by the user and the
* relevant actions to be executed with accordance to the command.
* @return Whether the command made any changes to the task list
* This command allows deleting of task in the task manager.
Messages.DIVIDER_UNDERSCORE_EXTENDED + " Delete all or a specific task in the task list.\n"
+ " The index specified should correspond to the index in the normal listing of tasks.\n"
+ " Type 'list' to view the normal listing of tasks.\n\n"
* @param isDeleteAll Whether to delete all the tasks in the task list
* @param index Index of the current task (in the task list) to be deleted
* @return Whether the command made any changes to the task list
* This command exits the program gracefully
* Returns true if the user's given input matches any of the terminating words
* @param input Command input given by user
* @return If the given input matches any accepted terminating words.
* @return Default return false as this command does not make changes to the task list
* This command allows the search of tasks that have their description matching the word provided.
* Provides 2 type of searches (Word search & Character search). Default is word search
// Parameter indicating a character search instead
Messages.DIVIDER_UNDERSCORE + " Find a task that have its description matching the keyword provided.\n"

+ " Options:
    -c     Character Search. Default is word search.

"
* @param isCharacterSearch If it is to perform a character search
* @return Default return false as this command does not make changes to the task list
* This command display the help page to act as a user guide to the program
+ " This is a simplified help page for all available commands supported by Duke.\n"
+ " Type 'help <command>' to view detailed functionalities for the specified command.\n"
+ " list        | Display all tasks in the task list.\n" + Messages.DIVIDER_DASH_EXTENDED
+ " todo        | Add a task with a description.\n"
+ " deadline    | Add a task with a deadline.\n"
+ " event       | Add an event on a specific date.\n"
+ " fixed       | Add a task that require a fixed amount of time to complete.\n"
+ " edit        | Edit the date / description of a specific task.\n" + Messages.DIVIDER_DASH_EXTENDED
+ " mark        | Mark a task as completed / done.\n"
+ " unmark      | Mark a task as ongoing.\n" + Messages.DIVIDER_DASH_EXTENDED
+ " find        | Find a task that have its description matching the keyword provided.\n"
+ " clone       | Make a copy of a task that is in the task list.\n" + Messages.DIVIDER_DASH_EXTENDED
+ " delete      | Delete all or a specific task in the task list.\n" + Messages.DIVIDER_DASH_EXTENDED
* @param message Help page to print to the user
* @return Default return false as this command does not make changes to the task list
* This command indicates that the given command is invalid.
